## ğŸ“‹ Content Quality Checklist

### Writing & Grammar
- [ ] **Spell-checked** - No typos or spelling errors
- [ ] **Grammar correct** - Proper sentence structure and punctuation
- [ ] **Clarity** - Content is easy to understand
- [ ] **Conciseness** - No unnecessary verbosity
- [ ] **Tone** - Professional, consistent with repo style

### Markdown & Formatting
- [ ] **Markdown valid** - Proper syntax, no formatting errors
- [ ] **Headings structured** - Logical hierarchy (H1 â†’ H2 â†’ H3)
- [ ] **Lists formatted** - Proper bullets/numbering
- [ ] **Code blocks** - Correct syntax highlighting (```language)
- [ ] **Links formatted** - Proper markdown link syntax
- [ ] **Tables aligned** - If applicable, tables are readable

### Documentation Standards
- [ ] **Follows style guide** - Consistent with existing documentation
- [ ] **Cross-references** - Links to related guides included
- [ ] **Examples provided** - Real-world scenarios or code samples
- [ ] **Best practices noted** - Industry standards highlighted with âœ…
- [ ] **âš ï¸ Warnings noted** - Common mistakes highlighted with âŒ

### For Service Documentation, includes:
- [ ] **Overview** - Clear explanation of what the service does
- [ ] **Use Cases** - When and why to use this service
- [ ] **Pricing** - Cost breakdown with real examples
- [ ] **Getting Started** - Hands-on setup instructions
- [ ] **Best Practices** - Do's âœ… and Don'ts âŒ
- [ ] **Troubleshooting** - Common issues and solutions
- [ ] **Comparisons** - How it differs from alternatives
- [ ] **Next Steps** - Links to related guides

### For Code Examples
- [ ] **Syntax correct** - Code examples are valid
- [ ] **Tested** - Examples have been tested to work
- [ ] **Well-commented** - Code is explained with comments
- [ ] **Language specified** - Code block has language identifier
- [ ] **Output shown** - Expected output is documented
